content:
Can you help me solve this puzzle using Scala? I have a quadratic equation with a leading coefficient greater than 1 and I need to find its x-intercepts. Here's the catch - I can only use the quadratic formula! 
To make things more interesting, I'll give you the values of a, b, and c as a table: 
|  a  |  b  |  c  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  2  |  5  |  2  |
Can you write a Scala code that will use the quadratic formula to find the x-intercepts of this equation? But be careful, there might not be any real roots! Good luck!
